Class Ticket

java.lang.Object
com.lucas.ticketsalesmanager.models.Ticket
public class Ticket extends Object
The Ticket class represents a ticket for a specific event. It contains information about the event, price, seat, and whether the ticket is active or not.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Ticket(Event event, float price, String seat)
    Constructs a new Ticket with the provided event, price, and seat.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ticket

      public Ticket(Event event, float price, String seat)
      Constructs a new Ticket with the provided event, price, and seat. The ticket is created as active by default.
      Parameters:
      event - The event associated with the ticket.
      price - The price of the ticket.
      seat - The designated seat.

  • Method Details

    • getEvent

      public Event getEvent()
      Gets the event associated with the ticket.
      Returns:
      The ticket's event.

    • getPrice

      public float getPrice()
      Gets the price of the ticket.
      Returns:
      The ticket's price.

    • getSeat

      public String getSeat()
      Gets the seat assigned to the ticket.
      Returns:
      The ticket's seat.

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Checks if the ticket is active.
      Returns:
      true if the ticket is active, false otherwise.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Compares two Ticket objects to see if they are equal, based on event, price, seat, and active status.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - The object to be compared.
      Returns:
      true if the objects are equal, false otherwise.

    • toString

      Returns a string representation of the Ticket object.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string containing the ticket details.

    • cancel

      public boolean cancel()
      Cancels the ticket if it is active and the event has not yet occurred.
      Returns:
      true if the ticket was successfully canceled, false otherwise.

    • reactivate

      public void reactivate()
      Reactivates the ticket if it is inactive.
